Sentencas: A cobalt-free titanium-doped SrFeO3-delta perovskite with a nominal composition of SrFe0.9Ti0.1O3-delta (SFT) is exploited as an alternative electrode for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Cobalt-free SrFe0.9Ti0.1O3-δ as a high-performance electrode material for oxygen reduction reaction on doped ceria electrolyte with favorable CO2 tolerance

Sentencas: Special attention is given to the effects of CO2 on the oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) performance and properties of the oxide.
Titulo: Cobalt-free SrFe0.9Ti0.1O3-δ as a high-performance electrode material for oxygen reduction reaction on doped ceria electrolyte with favorable CO2 tolerance

Sentencas: For this investigation, XRD, HR-TEM, FT-IR, 4-probe DC conductivity, EIS and SEM are used.
Titulo: Cobalt-free SrFe0.9Ti0.1O3-δ as a high-performance electrode material for oxygen reduction reaction on doped ceria electrolyte with favorable CO2 tolerance

Sentencas: Although no bulk carbonate is formed, even under a pure CO2 atmosphere, the chemical adsorption of CO2 only appears over the SFT surface, which suggests a weak effect of CO2 on the structure of SFT.
Titulo: Cobalt-free SrFe0.9Ti0.1O3-δ as a high-performance electrode material for oxygen reduction reaction on doped ceria electrolyte with favorable CO2 tolerance

Sentencas: The EIS tests demonstrate that such CO2 adsorption does have a modest and detrimental effect on the ORR over the SFT electrode.
Titulo: Cobalt-free SrFe0.9Ti0.1O3-δ as a high-performance electrode material for oxygen reduction reaction on doped ceria electrolyte with favorable CO2 tolerance

Sentencas: However, the electrochemical performance can be easily recovered after removing of CO2.
Titulo: Cobalt-free SrFe0.9Ti0.1O3-δ as a high-performance electrode material for oxygen reduction reaction on doped ceria electrolyte with favorable CO2 tolerance

Sentencas: Thus, SrFe0.9Ti0.1O3-delta is a promising cathode material for practical SOFCs due to its high activity, high CO2 tolerance, and low cost.
Titulo: Cobalt-free SrFe0.9Ti0.1O3-δ as a high-performance electrode material for oxygen reduction reaction on doped ceria electrolyte with favorable CO2 tolerance
